posts.name: Lekhshree
posts.cooked: Previously, the grading document indicated that the ROE-1 for the Tools in Data Science course (Diploma in DS), September Term 2024, was scheduled for 17th November 2024 from 1:00 pm to 1:45 pm IST. However, it now shows “YTD”. Could you kindly clarify the discrepancy regarding the dates? Additionally, if I am unable to attend ROE-1, is there an option to take a make-up ROE?

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Hi Lekshree,

If you look in Course introduction, all the dates are mentioned there.

Screenshot 2024-10-16 at 10.51.162842×1000 315 KB

Kind regards

posts.name: Bahni Roy
posts.cooked:
Thank you Carlton. Couple of follow up questions though.

  1. Right above the timelines in the course dashboard, it mentions the Sep 2024 grading document as the document containing the latest official information. Do the timelines specified on the course dashboard (screenshot above) overrides all timelines mentioned in the Sep 2024 grading documentation for TDS? If that is the case, I would suggest that the grading document be synced up with these updates so the information stays consistent at all locations.
  2. The submission timeline for Project 1 (P1) has been specified as Nov 10, 2024 in the grading document, however, on the course dashboard the project submission date is mentioned as 28th Oct, 2024 (a mismatch of close to 2 weeks). Which one is the correct submission date for P1?
    In case it is 28th Oct, 2024 (as mentioned in the course dashboard), it will be a rather demanding timeline (specifically for students who have in center Quiz 1 for 3 subjects on 27th Oct) and the project submission date happens to be the very next day. Add to that the fact that some candidates need to travel (intra-city) to and from the test centre.
    Please review and advise on the dates mismatch (for all projects and exams for TDS).
    Thanks.

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Hi Bahni,

Agreed. I have informed operations to make sure that both the documents are in sync so that there is no confusion.

Kind regards

posts.name: Bahni Roy
posts.cooked:
Thank you Carlton. I refered to the grading document and see that the grading document is in sync now.

Can the course admin team take a look at point # 2 I mentioned above and respond? I noticed that the projects 1 and 2 have a timeframe of 10 days per project. Project # 1 has a release date of today (it has not been released until noon, I presume the project will be released later in the day). So, I am not sure what is the complexity level of project # 1. However, I raised the point of Quiz 1 because:
(a) There will be students who will be appearing in as many as 3 subjects in Quiz 1 (in the case they have TDS as their 4th subject), and
(b) There will be students who will be travelling intra city to appear for Quiz 1 (so in order to accomodate candidates who fall in this category, at the least, 26th, 27th and 28th Oct. should not even be considered as days which will be available to them to work on the project).

With that said, can the course admin team review the submission date for project 1 and provide flexibility considering overlap of Quiz 1 (e.g. preparations, mock tests (mock tests are typically solved by many in the week prior to the quiz) and the logistics involved on the part of the candidate, for example, intra-city travel (for many))?

posts.name: Bahni Roy
posts.cooked:
Just a bit of feedback to the course admin team because I do see there is a need for better planning around the timelines and offering flexibility when there are genuine reasons to do so. Consider these points:

  1. I mentioned in point (b) above that if the plan is to provide 10 days to work on projects 1 and 2 (publish till submission) that has a weightage of 20% overall, then I raised a pertinent point that 26th, 27th and 28th October should be excluded from the planning because there are students who travel inter city and we do spend a greater part of the two days pre and prior to the quiz date traveling to and from the test city. I did not receive any response on why that rationale (e.g. the case of students who travel inter city for the offline exams) should not be factored into in your planning. So effectively, for some, the days available for project 1 reduces to 7-8 (give or take).
  2. Week 4 GA assignment end date was scheduled just 1.5 days prior to Quiz 1 (and there are students who take up as many as 4 subjects per term and have to work on mock tests before appearing for the offline Quizzes)
  3. The submission date for Project 1 coincides with the date of a prominent national festival!
    If I may quote from the student’s handbook, there is a clear policy of offering flexibility around such key events (excerpt below):
    *Date has been changed keeping in mind quiz on Oct 27 and Diwali on Oct 31
    If weekly assignment submission date (which in most cases have a weightage of just 1%) can be adjusted keeping in mind key events, then a project that carries a weightage of 20% overall should have offered a few day’s additional flexibility in line with the stated policies in the Student’s handbook.
